text: If you missed our story from yesterday, Twitter has been algorithmically inserting popular tweets into feeds of users who do not follow the accounts that posted them, which has at times has amplified inflammatory political rhetoric, conspiracy theories, and misinformation...
author: oliverdarcy

text: If you were wondering what Mueller was doing last night after filing his report, ⁦@playbookplus⁩ has the answer.
author: oliverdarcy

text: The reax to the Mueller news so far in Russian media:

text: Discussed Twitter amplifying extreme political rhetoric & conspiracy theories on @CNNnewsroom w/@ryanobles. We also talked about how vaccine misinformation is still in plain sight on Facebook / Instagram. Misinformation run amok on these social platforms!
author: oliverdarcy

text: Mediaite's @aidnmclaughlin also reports @GreggJarrett was stripped of his "anchor" title because he "went off the deep end" https://www.mediaite.com/tv/inside-the-ad-boycotts-non-apologies-and-transfer-of-power-shaping-the-new-fox-news/ …
author: oliverdarcy

text: Mediaite reports that @SaraCarterDC is banned from appearing on Fox's news programs, and that leadership has told @seanhannity not to call her an "investigative reporter" on his show. He has responded by repeatedly calling her an "investigative reporter." https://www.mediaite.com/tv/inside-the-ad-boycotts-non-apologies-and-transfer-of-power-shaping-the-new-fox-news/ …
author: oliverdarcy

text: Of course, the irony of Twitter inserting some of these right-wing voices into feeds of users who do not follow them is that these are the people who keep accusing Twitter of "shadow banning" them. It's really...the opposite? https://www.cnn.com/2019/03/22/tech/twitter-algorithm-political-rhetoric/index.html …
author: oliverdarcy

text: Twitter's response to me was that users can turn off their automated curation, and that they are working to "continue to improve our efforts" with it. Spox also said amplified behavior should not "intimidate, harass, or threaten others." https://www.cnn.com/2019/03/22/tech/twitter-algorithm-political-rhetoric/index.html …
author: oliverdarcy

text: Some of the people I've noticed Twitter has been amplifying: Diamond & Silk, Bill Mitchell, Charlie Kirk, James Woods, Candace Owens https://www.cnn.com/2019/03/22/tech/twitter-algorithm-political-rhetoric/index.html …
author: oliverdarcy

text:
For months, Twitter has been inserting tweets from popular accounts into feeds of users who do not follow them. 

The practice means Twitter at times has amplified inflammatory political rhetoric, misinformation, and conspiracy theories.

My story:
author: oliverdarcy

text: Pam everyone knows this!!
author: oliverdarcy

text: “Mr. President, he’s dead. He can’t punch back. He’s dead."
author: oliverdarcy

text: Via The Wrap: @ZTPetrizzo says he lost his job at the conservative media organization Live Action for reporting on Twitter that Laura Loomer was "verbally tormenting" me at CPAC https://www.thewrap.com/reporter-laura-loomer-live-action-lose-job-resign-cpac-oliver-darcy/ …

text: The short term measures Instagram said it is taking includes blocking certain hashtags, such as "#vaccinescauseautism," "#vaccinesarepoison," and "#vaccinescausesids."
author: oliverdarcy

text:
I wrote about how vaccine misinformation is still flourishing on Facebook and Instagram weeks after the platforms promised crackdown. 

Insta spox told me they are taking some short-term measures, but said process has always been scheduled to take weeks. 

https://www.cnn.com/2019/03/21/tech/vaccine-misinformation-facebook-instagram/index.html …
author: oliverdarcy

text: Inbox: Gawker Names Dan Peres as Editor-in-Chief
author: oliverdarcy

text: As I said at the time, one does not need to go to 4chan to see vile/racist comments/discussions. The comment sections of some of the popular far-right sites (in this case, Breitbart, which POTUS tweeted a link to at the time of the attack) are littered with this kind of stuff.
author: oliverdarcy

text: —@katiecouric says her 2008 question about newspapers to Sarah Palin might not have had the same effect today: "I think there's such a reverse snobbery about intellectuals that I think it would almost be seen as a badge of honor"
author: oliverdarcy

text: When you search "vaccine" in Instagram, these are current results. Top hashtag is "#vaccineskill." Others include "#vaccineinjury," "#vaccinescauseautism," & others. Again, Facebook/Instagram announced they would crack down on vaccine misinfo on March 7th. What's taking so long?
author: oliverdarcy

text: Related: Weeks ago, Facebook/Instagram pledged to crackdown on vaccine misinfo, saying, "We won’t show or recommend content that contains misinformation about vaccinations on Instagram Explore or hashtag pages." But I just searched "vaccine" on Instagram & these were the results.
author: oliverdarcy

text: —@TaylorLorenz writes about how "Instagram is the Internet's new home" for hate, misinformation, and viral conspiracy theories
author: oliverdarcy

text: Trump continues to exacerbate a longstanding paranoia from conservatives who have for years erroneously accused social media companies of bias & censorship. I wrote this last year when he claimed social media companies were "silencing millions of people." https://money.cnn.com/2018/08/24/media/trump-big-tech-bias/index.html …

text: Seems like it. No surprise though. Remember back when "The Memo" was a hot thing. Fox News and the Washington Examiner both appeared to have been provided copies before other media organizations: https://money.cnn.com/2018/02/02/media/conservative-media-nunes-memo/index.html …

text: Trump’s message today is clear: he wants opinion (that supports him) and less hard news.

text: While Fox is trying to emphasize its news division, the network’s biggest fan is lashing out at it, while simultaneously boosting the channel’s opinion talking heads (who unfailingly support him) in separate tweets.
